result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel R. Reimer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Probation term on case 22CM77

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Upon successful completion of supervision with no rule violations.  Agent to file a memo with the court, 2 weeks prior to discharge date, outlining the defendant's adjustment on Probation.  The Agent is to specifically address whether the defendant had any rule violations; if so, what they were and when they occurred.

-AODA and any follow up treatment, which may include mental health, as deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. 
-No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
-Random tests.
-Defendant may not enter liquor stores, or bars or any establishment who's main purpose is to serve alcohol. 
-No contact with C.J. or Goodwill.
-No violent contact with Victims or any family members.

timeConds.notes: Court orders defendant perform 30 hours of community service.

records.addlTxt: Cases 22CF149, 22CM77 called together - 10:51 AM Defendant Samuel R. Reimer appeared by in person and in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Heather Dvoran. Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1 as amended, Ct. 2 & 3 of 22CF149. Court examines defendant, finds him guilty and renders sentence. On motion of the State, Ct. 4 & 5 of 22CF149 dismissed and readin. Defendant enters guilty plea to 22CM77. Court examines defendant, finds him guilty and renders sentence. DA requests restitution, if there is any.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Cases 22CF149 / 22CM77 - 10:32 AM Defendant Samuel R. Reimer appeared in person and by Atty. Rachel Boaz. Attorney Adam Gerol in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defendant waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Atty. Dvoran motion for bail modification. State opposes motion. Court denies bail modification.
Further proceedings scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Atty Dvoran requests hearing to be switched to 10am calendar for PD to represent. No objecting by State. Court grants request. Email sent to Corp Gahan.

Absolute sobriety. No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No vape pens. No contact by email, text, 3rd party with CJ or Goodwill. Scram bracelet installed if released from custody, must have installed on same day of release or wait until next day for release from custody. No contact with parents. Defendant may not go to his parents residence. Defendant is not to possess anyone's financial information.

Cases 22CF149 / 22CM77 called together- 1:37 PM Defendant Samuel R. Reimer in court and by Atty. Heather Dvoran.  Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Dvoran appears as friend of the Court, defendant may qualify for PD, need to review defendant's finances. Court finds good cause for not scheduling a preliminary hearing. State recommends $1000 cash bail. Court orders $2000 cash bond w/conditions.
Status hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
